caseNameFull: The PEOPLE, Respondent, v. EPIGMENIO MELENDREZ, Appellant

opinions.snippet:
The defendant was convicted of the crime of murder in the second degree, and appeals from the judgment and from an order denying a new trial.
The killing took place in the county of San Diego, near the village of Hedges. A man had been stabbed there by one Rosales, who had escaped. The people of the village, or many of them, including the defendant, were in pursuit of the fugitive, who — as also the deceased — was not personally known to the defendant. In the course of the

posture:

The facts are stated in the opinion.

caseNameFull: State of Maryland v. . Harry Magaha
judge: Sloan, Delaplaine, Collins, Marbury, Grason, Melvin, Adams

opinions.snippet: The State has brought this appeal to defend the constitutional validity of "General Rule Covering the Use of Streets," in the Traffic Ordinance of Baltimore City. The challenged section provides: "Reasonable care to be used. Nothing contained herein or omitted herefrom shall be construed or held to relieve any person using, or traveling or being upon any street, for any purpose whatever, from exercising all reasonable care to avoid or prevent injury through collision with all other persons an

posture:
Appeal from the Criminal Court of Baltimore City (O'DUNNE, J.).

Indictment charging Harry Magaha with violation of city ordinance by failing, while operating a trackless
trolley on a public street, to exercise reasonable care to avoid and prevent injury through collision with a motor ambulance. From an order sustaining a demurrer and quashing the indictment, the State appeals. Order reversed and case remanded.
